entry.title: [ios] Improve NTP fakebox focus animation
entry.content:
This change improves the animation that happens when the fakebox is

focused and morphs into the real omnibox. The text components should

animate from their location in the fakebox (leading aligned) to

their location when editing (slightly to the right with room for the

leading icon). The existing code sort of magically got close (by

calculating the width of "https://") but this change gets it exactly

pixel perfect.



This fix applies regardless of whether Large Fakebox is enabled.



Video with fix:

entry.content:
The font normally gets set as part of the process when the user begins

editing a URL. But if the NTP is displayed before a web page and the

user focuses the omnibox, the placeholder can be displayed in the wrong

font because none has been set yet. This fixes that by setting the font

in the initializer.

entry.title: heap, WTF: Fix race between HeapVector tracing and resizing
entry.content:
`Vector::resize` can be called during incremental marking. It will try

to initialize with memset the newly available slots.

In case the initial size was below capacity, and the new size doesn't

require allocating a new buffer, the concurrent marker may already be

handling the backing store at the same time the main thread is

initializing new slots with memset.



See race in https://luci-milo.appspot.com/ui/inv/task-chromium-swarm.appspot.com-6541a5fc58746111/test-results?q=ExactID%3Aninja%3A%2F%2Fcontent%2Ftest%3Acontent_browsertests%2FNavigationControllerHistoryInterventionBrowserTest.OnUserGestureResetSameDocumentEntriesSkipFlag%2FAll.RDAllFrames_BFCacheEnabled+VHash%3A9e749fb4b167a644



Change-Id: Ic4fe96b90f04ecf860f809f8cbaef79912ce7028

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4935184

Commit-Queue: Omer Katz

Reviewed-by: Michael Lippautz

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1210164}

entry.title: Fetch code cache from ResourceRequestSender.
entry.content:
Currently ResourceLoader::CodeCacheRequest fetches the code cache from

isolated code caches. This CL moves this logic to ResourceRequestSender.

It is required for BackgroundResourceFetch feature (crbug.com/1379780),

because we will need to fetch the code cache from the background thread

when the BackgroundResourceFetch feature is enabled.



In the new code, ResourceLoader passes a pointer of CodeCacheHost to

ResourceRequestSender::SendAsync() via URLLoader when DownloadToBlob

flag is false. And ResourceRequestSender fetches the code cache if

ShouldFetchCodeCache() returns true.



Currently ResourceLoader::CodeCacheRequest::FetchFromCodeCache() calls

url_loader->Freeze(LoaderFreezeMode::kStrict) to defer loading before

fetching data from code cache. This logic was originally implemented by

https://crrev.com/c/1154980. In the new code, this deferring logic is

implemented in ResourceRequestSender. ResourceRequestSender defers

method calls of ResourceRequestClient until it receives the response of

FetchCachedCode IPC call, or it receives a cached metadata from

OnReceivedResponse() method.



This CL also merges ResourceRequestSender::OnReceivedCachedMetadata()

method into ResourceRequestSender::OnReceivedResponse(). We can do so

because after crrev.com/c/3811219, cached metadata is sent from

ServiceWorker using URLLoaderClient::OnReceiveResponse() IPC.



This CL removes ResourceLoaderDefersLoadingTest which was introduce by

https://crrev.com/c/1209484 to check the deferring logic in

ResourceRequestSender. Also this CL merges

ResourceLoaderIsolatedCodeCacheTests into ResourceRequestSenderTest.



Bug: 1379780

Change-Id: I06b343009dbe97e74bb3b43d1d916ee2007c3604

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4910676

Commit-Queue: Tsuyoshi Horo

Reviewed-by: Leszek Swirski

Reviewed-by: Kentaro Hara

Reviewed-by: Kouhei Ueno

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1210160}

entry.content:

The kCookieDeprecationFacilitatedTesting was considered in

profile_keyed_service_browsertest through being added via the

fieldtrial_testing_config.json and "If a feature is integrated in the

fieldtrial_testing_config.json, it might not be considered under an official build."

entry.title: Use comparison against nullptr when using Member in boolean contexts
entry.content:
This allows moving to explicit operator T* for Member and also speeds up

the methods as boolean checks can work on compressed Member without

requiring decompression. See here [1] for the operator== overload.



This was automatically converted using

```

autoninja -C out/Release blink_tests -k 0 \

| grep " error: no viable conversion from returned value of type" \

| sort \

| uniq -c \

| sort -nr

| grep "'bool'" > out-bool.log

```



The build errors lead to a simple replace:

```

import fileinput

import re

import sys



bool_regex = r'(.*return\s)(.*)(;.*)$'

bool_replace = r'\1 \2 != nullptr \3'



def replace(file_name, line_nr):

i = 1

for line in fileinput.input(file_name, inplace=1):

if i == line_nr:

line = re.sub(bool_regex, bool_replace, line)

sys.stdout.write(line)

i += 1



with open (sys.argv[1]) as log_file:

for line in log_file:

file_parts = line.lstrip().split(' ')[1].split(':')

file_name, line_nr = file_parts[0], int(file_parts[1])

replace(file_name, line_nr)

```



This approach is conservative and may leave behind some more

complicated uses which will be fixed manually later.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:v8/include/cppgc/member.h;l=454&ss%3Dchromium



Bug: chromium:1492410

Change-Id: If78d43b6ef99b810844fb78f71d9c3b73a36b34c

entry.title: [iOS] Standardize handlers for settings view controllers.
entry.content:
Handler setup for settings view controllers was inconsistent. Most have

access to a 'dispatcher' property that combines Application, Browser,

and BrowsingData commands. This property is defined in the

SettingsRootViewControlling property that most of these view controllers

conform to by virtue of being subclasses of SettingsRootTableView-Controller.



Others also have a separate property for Snackbar commands, and some

have an additional Application commands handler, even though that can

be done through the Dispatcher.



Command injection was also heterogenous; the dispatcher property was

typically set in the various convenience initializers of Settings

NavigationController via various methods of the delegate protocol, even

though all of these initializers also pass a Browser which provides

a command dispatcher that can be used for all of these handlers.



SettingsNavigationControllerDelegate defined three methods for fetching

command handlers. One got the three-command 'handler for settings', one

got just an Application command handler, and one got the Snackbar

handler. Some implementations of this protocol had one or more of these

methods as no-ops with NOTREACHED(); this is not something that should

ever be done in a protocol (where parts of the API can just be makred

@optional if they are actually optional).



This CL standardizes things by:



- Defining separate handler properties for all command protocols in

SettingsRootViewControlling.



- Getting rid of the mis-named 'dispatcher' property.



- Setting handlers on view controllers based on the Browser that

SettingsNavigationController is initialized with, and removing the

handler fetching methods from that class's delegate protocol.



- Ensuring all handlers are set for all view controllers. Some utility

functions/methods are added to make this less boilerplate-y, although

coordinators do use the same chunk of setup code to set all of the

handlers on their view controllers.



Tests are updated to configure command dispatch correctly.



After this CL lands, follow-up CLs will prune some of these command

protocols from SettingsRootViewControlling, to remove unneeded

dependencies.



Bug: 1045047

Change-Id: I4bdcda997763170595e2416df39575cc7b9e33cb

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4895672

Reviewed-by: Gauthier Ambard

entry.title: [IOS] Add open extension EG test
entry.content:
Create an EGTest to check that the open extension works as

intended.

The real extension requires app_groups and uses Chrome scheme

so create a smaller one that requires no entitlement and

uses a customizable scheme.



This smaller extension uses the same method to open the

application, so it should be enough to test the application

openining.



This CL:

- Extracts the open url logic in a ios/chrome/common function

- Creates a small extension that use this function

- Creates an EG test that triggers this extension

- Refactor existing extension to use the function

- Cleans the share extension to use weakself in blocks as a cleanup.

* Tested by generating gn desc files locally.

entry.title: Prerender: Pass target_hint to Preload.prerenderStatusUpdated
entry.content:
This is a preparation CL for showing target_hint information on the

DevTools preloading panel. This CL passes the hint to

Preload.prerenderStatusUpdated.



This also fixes an issue that prerender-into-new-tab unexpectedly

creates 2 entries for the same prerendering attempt on the "Preloads"

view. Before this CL, blink/ created PreloadingAttemptKey with

target_hint but content/ created PreloadingAttemptKey without

target_hint. This resulted in key mismatch in the DevTools side and

showing updated information as separate entries. After this CL, both the

keys are created with target_hint and they match in the DevTools side.



Bug: 1431109, 1490384

Change-Id: Icb9e8b8dcbd482e281da26a04117c98f872ee7ee

entry.title: Account for Byte Offset in BodyStreamBuffer::ProcessData
entry.content:
When ReadableStreamBYOBReader.read() is passed an Uint8Array with an

offset into the buffer > 0, it always writes to the buffer at offset 0.

This CL fixes the behavior in BodyStreamBuffer, so it writes from the

offset.

valid.

crbug.com/1491096.



Unittests in TwoScreensSigninCoordinatorTest makes sure no upgrade

promo metrics/prefs are updated when TwoScreensSigninCoordinator is

created with another the access point than ACCESS_POINT_SIGNIN_PROMO.



EGTests in UpgradeSigninPromoTestCase checks that the upgrade promo

updates upgrade promo metrics/prefs, with

kReplaceSyncPromosWithSignInPromos flag enabled.



This patch had to move constants from user_signin_constants.h and

upgrade_signin_logger.mm to signin_constants.h, so they can be used

in unittests and EGTests.



Also `-[ChromeEarlGrey userDefaultObjectForKey:]` is added.



Bug: 1470750

entry.title: Ambient: Prevent managed screensaver from running in kiosk mode.
entry.content:
Add IsKioskSession to stop the managed screensaver logic from starting

in kiosk mode.



Managed screensaver, when enabled, would run the state machine and stop

the screensaver right before creating the widget and starting the ui

launcher session. With this change, the managed screensaver will not

be enabled on kiosk devices, regardless of the managed pref value.



Bug: b:301094384

Test: ash_unittest --gtest_filter=*ManagedScreensaver*

entry.title: Fixed stack use after return in test function.
entry.content:
This patch fixes a rare stack use after return in test only scenarios.

Found in our asan runs. Problem occurs in scenario when base::RunLoop

inside PrerenderHost::WaitForLoadStopForTesting is exited not by

calling QuitClosure but by destroying RunLoop because of test timeout.

In this case variable on_wait_loading_finished_ remains non null after

function returns and this lead to calling callback inside it from

~PrerenderHost. Because test callback is binded to local stack variable

in WaitForLoadStopForTesting this leads to asan detecting error of stack

after return. So such test timeouts are detected as asan failure.



Change-Id: I4655bdcd250ca049c276320b0c83599d93c11717

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4935385

Reviewed-by: Takashi Toyoshima

Commit-Queue: Alexander Yashkin

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1210079}

entry.title: pip-pinch: Disallow offscreen bounds during resist
entry.content:
The resistance effect (b/298282501) uses `gfx::Transform.Scale()` to

visually change the size of the window, but it only changes the visual

screen size and the window's actual bounds are not scaled with the

transform. The bounds correction that keeps the PiP window inside the

screen uses the bounds to calculate the obstacle avoidance, so the PiP

window was allowed to momentarily go partially offscreen during the

effect.



This commit adds new `PipPositioner::GetBoundsForDrag` that takes

`gfx::Transform` as an argument and returns the bounds that avoids the

obstacles even with the scale effect applied.



during the resistance effect.



Bug: b/303150761

Test: Manually confirmed that the window does not go out of bounds even

entry.title: [WPT] Remove expectations for a test which asserts that the V8 code cache impl is buggy
entry.content:
The test expectations contained "FAIL" lines; this means that the test

"fails" if Chromium for some reason displays the non-buggy behavior.

This happens especially when the V8 code cache is disabled. V8 code

cache is an implementation detail and should not be observable.

Currently it is only observable because of this bug.



We need to disable the V8 code cache for producing crowdsourced compile

hints. Currently, the decision to produce the data is done based on

client-side randomization, so this means that the test fails flakily

with a very low percentage.



This CL removes the test expectation (effectively expecting only PASSes) and adds a TestExpectation entry for it.



Drive-by: fix the flag name in the "produce compile hints" field trial.



Bug: chromium:1244145, chromium:1406506

Change-Id: I44a96e6dd0e4c252368f2b2a0bf2eb2dc538e6a0

entry.title: Fix flipped screen sharing on ARC.
entry.content:
This is a follow-up fix of crrev.com/c/4763084.



Because the change changed the source from bottom-left

origin to top-left origin but did not change the

consumer (Android screen sharing API which already

assumed top-left), we had to set flip_output=false.



I guess flipped_source doesn't matter because in

ARC screen capture we always copy the whole rectangle,

but IIUC in the latest code, top/bottom is not flipped,

so I hope setting false here is correct.

entry.title: Pass --disable-field-trial-config to tests that need it.
entry.content:
Affected tests already run without the testing config applied,

so this CL makes it explicit.



Context: Browser tests that use ScopedFeatureList and pass

params presently cause the field trial testing config to be

entirely disabled. (details: crbug.com/1491463#c8)

We plan to fix this, but some existing tests rely on this

(fail with the testing config). This CL annotates those

tests explicitly by making them specify the flag for that.



Once all the CLs updating such tests land (sharded via git

cl split), the following CL to make ScopedFeatureList not

disable the testing config can land:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4935093



As many tests are affected, it will be up to their owners

to do any necessary follow up if the tests should be made to

pass with the testing config (per the comments this CL adds).



Note: I did a best effort to have the new flag only apply to the

subset of tests that needed it when it was a single or a small

number of tests that were affected, by introducing subclasses

for the affected tests. In other cases, where lots of tests in

the same file fail, the flag is added to the original test class.



Note: The --disable-field-trial-config flag is passed simply

by name intentionally, to avoid additional complexity from

depending on components/variations and includes to reference

the existing constant for it. The name is unlikely to change and

this way, we need less complex code to add this to the tests.



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.



R=lingqi@chromium.org



Bug: 1491463

entry.title: [Files F2] Refine focus logic for the tree widget
entry.content:
* Mouse interaction (click/double click/right click) on the tree

should:

* focus on the tree itself if the click target is outside

the tree item (e.g. the blank area).

* focus on tee tree item if the click target is on the tree

item.

To maintain this we bind the event handler on the host element

level instead of the root level.

* When tree items get removed, the focused item inside should be

update accordingly: set it to the selected item if exists,

otherwise set it to null.

* Update focus related CSS to use focus-outline-visible class,

the native :focus-visible will show focus ring even without

keyboard interaction, which is not what we want.



Bug: b:302642915

Test: browser_tests --gtest_filter="*XfTree*"

entry.title: url: Implement URL.canParse.
entry.content:
The WPT is adjusted slightly since it currently exercises behavior

it was presumably not intended to -- namely, the quirk we have on

Windows where URLs which begin with a single letter and a colon are

interpreted as file URLs relative to the given drive letter.



The particulars of URL parsing are adequately tested elsewhere, and

this test serves to demonstrate that URL.canParse(...) behaves the

same way that new URL(...) does.

entry.title: Use cached context caret bounds to show mako UI.
entry.content:
Currently, we try to anchor the mako UI at the caret bounds for the

active text input client. This has some issues, e.g.



1. When the mako UI is triggered from a freeform prompt, it is

incorrectly anchored at the freeform text input rather than the

original text context.

2. If there is no active text input client (e.g. if a native panel chip

is focused), the mako UI doesn't show up at all.



Fix this by caching the caret bounds when the native panel requests the

current editor context, then using these cached caret bounds to show

subsequent mako UI.



Bug: b:302055240

Change-Id: I1b9ab152b1eefc84c9307c3f6f637b9dc69e915c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4941631

entry.title: Implement PrerenderURLLoaderThrottle::DetachFromCurrentSequence()
entry.content:
When PrerenderURLLoaderThrottle was initially introduced by [1], it

supported DetachFromCurrentSequence(). But this method was marked as

NOTREACHED by [2], because sync XHR is not supported for

NoStatePrefetch. But we are planning to call this method for

BackgroundResourceFetch. So this CL re-implements the

DetachFromCurrentSequence() method, also adds some tests.



[1] https://crrev.com/c/855041

[2] https://crrev.com/c/1981101

> and the presubmit rules related to GM3.

> * delete the old CSS file (e.g. file_manager.css)

> file_manager.css)

> file_manager.css directly, which is not the case.

entry.title: [CloudOpenMetrics] Check for inconsistencies in metric logging
entry.content:
Define ~CloudOpenMetrics() to check for inconsistencies:

- TaskResult must be logged.

- If TaskResult is kFallbackQuickOffice or kCancelledAtFallback.

- Errors must be kOffline or kDriveFsInterface.

- TransferRequired must not be logged.

- UploadResult must not be logged.



Introduce Metric methods:

- ExpectNotLogged()

- ExpectLogged()

- ExpectLoggedWith()

that expects a metric to be not logged, logged or logged with a specific

value. If not, update the state to an inconsistent state.



Introduce CloudOpenMetrics methods:

- HandlePossibleInconsistency()

- ExpectNotLoggedRelativeToParent()

- ExpectLoggedRelativeToParent()

To call the above metric methods and then handle any resulting

inconsistent state by printing debug information.



Also remove set_state() as the state is now set internally.
